script.name: !plugin.autotrade.buytunings
script.description: Autotrade - Buy upgrades at Trade Stations (thrust, rudder, cargo)

line.comment: * script call is updated for LU 1.3.5
* skip bigger ships if below lvl 12, else they slow down their levelling.
* reaching jump ability quickly is much more important
* TODO: jumpdrive logic has changed, consider changing this too
* split amount needed up through coming experience levels
* fresh traders with small cargo bay should immediately buy all expansions
* only invest into cargo expansion if jump drive is already on board.
* buy tunings if experience >= 12 or if ship is small and needs cargo expansions
* small ships can upgrade their cargo for a low price and the ROI is much higher
* quicksearch: get amount that costs less than allowed
* half the amount is still too expensive
* half the amount is fine, result is in upper half
* Check player money, invest max 10% of money
* quicksearch: get amount that costs less than allowed
* half the amount is still too expensive
* half the amount is fine, result is in upper half
* $Tradestation-> send signal [SIGNAL_SELWARE] : arg1=[THIS], arg2=$ware, arg3=$amount, arg4=$price

sval.val: Autotrade - Buy upgrades at Trade Stations (thrust, rudder, cargo)

Method declaration

skip bigger ships if below lvl 12, else they slow down their levelling.

fresh traders with small cargo bay should immediately buy all expansions

only invest into cargo expansion if jump drive is already on board.
buy tunings if experience >= 12 or if ship is small and needs cargo expansions
small ships can upgrade their cargo for a low price and the ROI is much higher

got it
half the amount is still too expensive
half the amount is fine, result is in upper half

quicksearch: get amount that costs less than allowed
got it
half the amount is still too expensive

replaced by $arrived
skip if [DOCKEDAT] == $Tradestation
goto label return:
TODO: check if this works
$cost.mod = $cost.total mod $amount
$price = $cost.total / $amount
do if $cost.mod >= $price
inc $price
$Tradestation-> send signal [SIGNAL_SELWARE] : arg1=[THIS], arg2=$ware, arg3=$amount, arg4=$price
eliminate rounding error
$cost.total = $amount * $price
Ok back to business
